decks.notes: This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while maintaining card advantage and board control. It uses versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, along with counter spells and board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and generate value over time. The inclusion of Shark Typhoon and Expressive Iteration helps generate card advantage and apply pressure on the opponent. The manabase is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells with Cascade to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, players can trigger Cascade and cast cards like Crashing Footfalls for free, providing a constant stream of threats. The deck also includes versatile cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Cryptic Command to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggression and control, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a quick victory.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on using a combination of powerful Planeswalkers, efficient threats, and disruptive spells to put constant pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Tarmogoyf, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock. With versatile removal spells like Assassin's Trophy, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt, the deck can deal with a variety of threats while maintaining a proactive game plan.

This UB Mill deck focuses on quickly milling the opponent's library through a combination of milling creatures like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab, along with powerful mill spells like Fractured Sanity and Maddening Cacophony. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Surgical Extraction to control the opponent's resources. The goal is to mill the opponent's entire library as fast as possible, utilizing cards like Archive Trap and Visions of Beyond to draw cards and maintain card advantage while wearing down the opponent's library.

This deck focuses on fast and efficient aggression through low-cost spells and creatures, utilizing cards that can both provide card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggressive threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Counterspell, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while maintaining control of the game. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Thought Scour allows for card selection and graveyard synergy to further maximize the deck's effectiveness in quickly closing out games.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder, which creates an infinite life gain loop. The deck uses cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl to ramp up mana quickly, while also utilizing Collected Company and Ranger-Captain of Eos to find key pieces. Auriok Champion provides protection and lifegain, while Skyclave Apparition handles opposing threats. The goal is to establish a dominating board presence with creatures and gain infinite life to outlast the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through creatures with high mana costs such as Striped Riverwinder and Curator of Mysteries using cards like Architects of Will and Street Wraith. Once the graveyard is filled with these costly creatures, the player can cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Brazen Borrower to control the opponent's board while building up the combo. The goal is to set up a powerful combo finish with Living End and close out the game decisively.

The focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent through a combination of low-cost spells and aggressive creatures. With a heavy emphasis on generating extra value through cards like Clever Lumimancer and Monastery Swiftspear, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish a strong defense. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion, ensuring that the pressure is kept on the opponent at all times.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful Elemental creatures and spells while also utilizing the Companion aspect of Kaheera, the Orphanguard for added value. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Solitude, and Ephemerate provide disruption and protection, while cards like Risen Reef and Omnath, Locus of Creation generate advantage and pressure. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the Elemental theme of the deck and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with strong Human creatures that can benefit from each other's abilities, as well as disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The inclusion of cards like Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat help to accelerate the deployment of creatures onto the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Reflector Mage provide additional control over the opponent's board, making it difficult for them to stabilize or mount a defense. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Human tribal deck.

The deck revolves around taking extra turns through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Time Warp, while also controlling the board with cards like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt. The combo aspect comes from using Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Wrenn and Six and Velomachus Lorehold. The deck aims to have a steady stream of threats and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the various color requirements of the spells in the deck.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of [[Puresteel Paladin]] and [[Colossus Hammer]] in order to equip the hammer for free and swing for lethal damage as early as possible. It also utilizes [[Stoneforge Mystic]] to search for key equipment pieces and has support from cards like [[Esper Sentinel]] for card advantage and disruption. The inclusion of [[Lurrus of the Dream-Den]] as a companion allows for additional value and recursion. The deck is designed to be fast and aggressive, looking to win the game in just a few turns.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to finish off opponents or control the board. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells and card draw, while also utilizing the graveyard with cards like Murktide Regent and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is designed to support the quick and aggressive nature of the deck, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Colossus Hammer and Puresteel Paladin along with Stoneforge Mystic to quickly equip powerful equipment to creatures and deal massive damage to the opponent. By utilizing efficient low-cost creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with fast aggro plays. The inclusion of cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Sanctifier en-Vec provide additional support and protection, making the deck a versatile and powerful contender in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of equipping Colossus Hammer onto a creature, typically through Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic, to deal massive damage quickly. It also utilizes cheap or free artifacts like Ornithopter and Memnite to enable this combo. The deck also includes utility cards like Esper Sentinel for card advantage and disruption tools like Pithing Needle and Shadowspear. The companion option Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides added value by allowing the player to recast key creatures from the graveyard. With a mix of aggressive and resilient cards, this deck aims to win the game by combining powerful equipment with efficient creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. It utilizes Eldrazi lands to ramp up mana production and cast big threats early in the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and Warping Wail to deal with opposing threats. By combining fast creature plays with disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy while controlling the battlefield.
